00120     def __init__(
00121             self,
00122             running=False,
00123             timeDelay=10,
00124             *args,
00125             **kwargs):
00126         #print "MicropolisGenericEngine.__init__", self, "calling micropolisengine.Micropolis.__init__", micropolisengine.Micropolis.__init__, args, kwargs
00127 
00128         micropolisengine.Micropolis.__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
00129 
00130         self.resourceDir = 'res'
00131         self.running = running
00132         self.timeDelay = timeDelay
00133         self.timerActive = False
00134         self.timerId = None
00135         self.views = []
00136         self.interests = {}
00137         self.residentialImage = None
00138         self.commercialImage = None
00139         self.industrialImage = None
00140         self.transportationImage = None
00141         self.populationDensityImage = None
00142         self.rateOfGrowthImage = None
00143         self.landValueImage = None
00144         self.crimeRateImage = None
00145         self.pollutionDensityImage = None
00146         self.trafficDensityImage = None
00147         self.powerGridImage = None
00148         self.fireCoverageImage = None
00149         self.policeCoverageImage = None
00150         self.dataTileEngine = tileengine.TileEngine()
00151         self.robots = []
00152         self.robotDict = {}
00153         self.zoneMap = {}
00154         self.saveFileDir = None
00155         self.saveFileName = None
00156         self.metaFileName = None
00157         self.title = ''
00158         self.description = ''
00159         self.readOnly = False
00160         self.gameMode = 'stopped'
00161 
00162 
00163         # NOTE: Because of a bug in SWIG, printing out the wrapped
00164         # objects results in a crash.  So don't do that! I hope this
00165         # bug in SWIG gets fixed.
00166         # TODO: Report SWIG bug, if it's not already known or fixed.
00167 
00168         # Hook the engine up so it has a handle on its Python object side.
00169         self.userData = micropolisengine.getPythonCallbackData(self)
00170         #print "USERDATA"#, self.userData
00171 
00172         # Hook up the language independent callback mechanism to our
00173         # low level C++ Python dependent callback handler.
00174 
00175         self.callbackHook = micropolisengine.getPythonCallbackHook()
00176         #print "CALLBACKHOOK"#, self.callbackHook
00177 
00178         # Hook up the Python side of the callback handler, defined in
00179         # our scripted subclass of the SWIG wrapper.
00180 
00181         self._invokeCallback = self.invokeCallback # Cache to prevent GC
00182         self.callbackData = \
00183             micropolisengine.getPythonCallbackData(
00184                 self._invokeCallback)
00185         #print "CALLBACKDATA"#, self.callbackData
00186 
00187         self.expressInterest(
00188             self,
00189             ('paused',))
00190 
00191         self.initGame()
00192 
00193         if self.running:
00194             self.startTimer()
00195 
00196         #print "MicropolisEngine.__init__ done", self
00197

00213     def formatMoney(
00214         self,
00215         money):
00216         return '$' + self.formatNumber(money)
00217 
00218 
00219     def formatPercent(
00220         self,
00221         percent):
00222         return str(int(0.5 + (percent * 100))) + "%"
00223 
00224 
00225     def formatDelta(
00226         self,
00227         delta):
00228         if delta < 0:
00229             return self.formatNumber(delta)
00230         else:
00231             return '+' + self.formatNumber(delta)
00232 
00233 
00234     def formatNumber(
00235         self,
00236         number):
00237         negative = number < 0
00238         if negative:
00239             number = -number
00240         s = str(number)
00241         if len(s) > 9:
00242             s = s[-12:-9] + ',' + s[-9:-6] + ',' + s[-6:-3] + ',' + s[-3:]
00243         elif len(s) > 6:
00244             s = s[:-6] + ',' + s[-6:-3] + ',' + s[-3:]
00245         elif len(s) > 3:
00246             s = s[:-3] + ',' + s[-3:]
00247         if negative:
00248             s = '-' + s
00249         return s
00250 
00251 
00252     def addView(self, view):
00253         views = self.views
00254         if view not in views:
00255             self.views.append(view)
00256             print "ADDVIEW", view
00257 
00258 
00259     def removeView(self, view):
00260         views = self.views
00261         if view in views:
00262             views.remove(view)
00263             print "REMOVEVIEW", view
00264

00266     def getMapImage(
00267         self,
00268         width=micropolisengine.WORLD_W,
00269         height=micropolisengine.WORLD_H,
00270         overlay='all'):
00271 
00272         #print "getMapImage"
00273 
00274         tileSize = micropolisengine.EDITOR_TILE_SIZE
00275 
00276         worldW = micropolisengine.WORLD_W
00277         worldH = micropolisengine.WORLD_H
00278 
00279         tileWidth = int(width / worldW)
00280         tileHeight = int(height / worldH)
00281 
00282         #print width, height, tileSize, width % tileWidth, height % tileHeight, tileWidth != tileHeight
00283 
00284         if (# Size must not be zero or negative.
00285             (width < worldW) or
00286             (height < worldH) or
00287             # Size must not be bigger than 16x16 tile.
00288             (width > worldW * tileSize) or
00289             (height > worldH * tileSize) or
00290             # Size must be multiple of tile size.
00291             ((width % tileWidth) != 0) or
00292             ((height % tileHeight) != 0) or
00293             # Size must be 1:1 aspect ratio.
00294             (tileWidth != tileHeight)):
00295             print "MicropolisGenericEngine getMapImage invalid size", width, height
00296             return None
00297 
00298         tileSize = tileWidth
00299 
00300         surface = cairo.ImageSurface(cairo.FORMAT_ARGB32, width, height)
00301         ctx = cairo.Context(surface)
00302 
00303         alpha = 1.0
00304 
00305         self.renderTiles(
00306             ctx,
00307             tileSize,
00308             0,
00309             0,
00310             worldW,
00311             worldH,
00312             alpha)
00313 
00314         overlayImage, overlayAlpha, overlayWidth, overlayHeight = \
00315             self.getDataImageAlphaSize(overlay)
00316         #print "OVERLAY", overlay, "IMAGE", overlayImage, overlayAlpha, overlayWidth, overlayHeight
00317         if overlayImage:
00318             overlayWidth = 1.0 / overlayWidth
00319             overlayHeight = 1.0 / overlayHeight
00320 
00321             ctx.save()
00322 
00323             ctx.scale(
00324                 worldW * tileSize,
00325                 worldH * tileSize)
00326 
00327             ctx.rectangle(0, 0, 1, 1)
00328             ctx.clip()
00329 
00330             imageWidth = overlayImage.get_width()
00331             imageHeight = overlayImage.get_height()
00332 
00333             ctx.scale(
00334                 overlayWidth / imageWidth,
00335                 overlayHeight / imageHeight)
00336 
00337             ctx.set_source_surface(
00338                 overlayImage,
00339                 0,
00340                 0)
00341             ctx.paint_with_alpha(overlayAlpha)
00342 
00343             ctx.restore()
00344 
00345         return surface
00346 
00347 
00348     def getDataImageAlphaSize(self, name):
00349         # @todo: cache images
00350         if name == 'all':
00351             return self.getAllImageAlphaSize()
00352         elif name == 'residential':
00353             return self.getResidentialImageAlphaSize()
00354         elif name == 'commercial':
00355             return self.getCommercialImageAlphaSize()
00356         elif name == 'industrial':
00357             return self.getIndustrialImageAlphaSize()
00358         elif name == 'transportation':
00359             return self.getTransportationImageAlphaSize()
00360         elif name == 'populationdensity':
00361             return self.getPopulationDensityImageAlphaSize()
00362         elif name == 'rateofgrowth':
00363             return self.getRateOfGrowthImageAlphaSize()
00364         elif name == 'landvalue':
00365             return self.getLandValueImageAlphaSize()
00366         elif name == 'crimerate':
00367             return self.getCrimeRateImageAlphaSize()
00368         elif name == 'pollutiondensity':
00369             return self.getPollutionDensityImageAlphaSize()
00370         elif name == 'trafficdensity':
00371             return self.getTrafficDensityImageAlphaSize()
00372         elif name == 'powergrid':
00373             return self.getPowerGridImageAlphaSize()
00374         elif name == 'firecoverage':
00375             return self.getFireCoverageImageAlphaSize()
00376         elif name == 'policecoverage':
00377             return self.getPoliceCoverageImageAlphaSize()
00378         else:
00379             print "MicropolisGenericEngine: getImageAlphaSize: Invalid data image name:", name
00380             return None, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0
00381 
00382 
00383     def getAllImageAlphaSize(self):
00384         return None, 1.0, 1.0, 1.0
00385 
00386 
00387     def getResidentialImageAlphaSize(self):
00388         image = self.residentialImage
00389         if not image:
00390             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W, WORLD_H)
00391             self.residentialImage = image
00392         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00393 
00394         buffer = self.getMapBuffer()
00395         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00396         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00397         tengine.width = WORLD_W
00398         tengine.height = WORLD_H
00399 
00400         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00401         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED
00402         tengine.colBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE * micropolisengine.WORLD_H
00403         tengine.rowBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE
00404 
00405         transparent = 0
00406         land = 1
00407         water = 2
00408 
00409         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00410             tileMasked = tile & LOMASK
00411             if tileMasked == RIVER:
00412                 result = water
00413             elif tileMasked >= COMBASE:
00414                 result = land
00415             else:
00416                 result = transparent
00417             return result
00418 
00419         tengine.renderPixels(
00420             image,
00421             self.terrainColorMap,
00422             tileFunction,
00423             None,
00424             0,
00425             0,
00426             WORLD_W,
00427             WORLD_H)
00428 
00429         return image, 0.8, 1.0, 1.0
00430 
00431 
00432     def getCommercialImageAlphaSize(self):
00433         image = self.commercialImage
00434         if not image:
00435             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W, WORLD_H)
00436             self.commercialImage = image
00437         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00438 
00439         buffer = self.getMapBuffer()
00440         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00441         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00442         tengine.width = WORLD_W
00443         tengine.height = WORLD_H
00444 
00445         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00446         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED
00447         tengine.colBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE * micropolisengine.WORLD_H
00448         tengine.rowBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE
00449 
00450         transparent = 0
00451         land = 1
00452         water = 2
00453 
00454         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00455             tileMasked = tile & LOMASK
00456             if tileMasked == RIVER:
00457                 result = water
00458             elif ((tileMasked > COMLAST) or
00459                   ((tileMasked >= LVRAIL6) and
00460                    (tileMasked < COMBASE))):
00461                 result = land
00462             else:
00463                 result = transparent
00464             return result
00465 
00466         tengine.renderPixels(
00467             image,
00468             self.terrainColorMap,
00469             tileFunction,
00470             None,
00471             0,
00472             0,
00473             WORLD_W,
00474             WORLD_H)
00475 
00476         return image, 0.8, 1.0, 1.0
00477 
00478 
00479     def getIndustrialImageAlphaSize(self):
00480         image = self.industrialImage
00481         if not image:
00482             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W, WORLD_H)
00483             self.industrialImage = image
00484         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00485 
00486         buffer = self.getMapBuffer()
00487         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00488         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00489         tengine.width = WORLD_W
00490         tengine.height = WORLD_H
00491 
00492         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00493         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED
00494         tengine.colBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE * micropolisengine.WORLD_H
00495         tengine.rowBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE
00496 
00497         transparent = 0
00498         land = 1
00499         water = 2
00500 
00501         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00502             tileMasked = tile & LOMASK
00503             if tileMasked == RIVER:
00504                 result = water
00505             elif (((tileMasked >= RESBASE) and (tileMasked < INDBASE)) or
00506                   ((tileMasked >= PORTBASE) and (tileMasked < SMOKEBASE)) or
00507                   ((tileMasked >= TINYEXP) and (tileMasked <= TINYEXPLAST)) or
00508                   (tileMasked >= FOOTBALLGAME1)):
00509                 result = land
00510             else:
00511                 result = transparent
00512             return result
00513 
00514         tengine.renderPixels(
00515             image,
00516             self.terrainColorMap,
00517             tileFunction,
00518             None,
00519             0,
00520             0,
00521             WORLD_W,
00522             WORLD_H)
00523 
00524         return image, 0.8, 1.0, 1.0
00525

00527     def getTransportationImageAlphaSize(self):
00528         image = self.commercialImage
00529         if not image:
00530             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W, WORLD_H)
00531             self.commercialImage = image
00532         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00533 
00534         buffer = self.getMapBuffer()
00535         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00536         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00537         tengine.width = WORLD_W
00538         tengine.height = WORLD_H
00539 
00540         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00541         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED
00542         tengine.colBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE * micropolisengine.WORLD_H
00543         tengine.rowBytes = micropolisengine.BYTES_PER_TILE
00544 
00545         transparent = 0
00546         land = 1
00547         water = 2
00548 
00549         # FIXME: Exclude the smokestack animations used by the coal power plant.
00550 
00551         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00552             tileMasked = tile & LOMASK
00553             if tileMasked == RIVER:
00554                 result = water
00555             elif ((tileMasked >= RESBASE) or
00556                   ((tileMasked >= BRWXXX7) and (tileMasked <= LVPOWER10)) or
00557                   (tileMasked == UNUSED_TRASH6)):
00558                 result = land
00559             else:
00560                 result = transparent
00561             return result
00562 
00563         tengine.renderPixels(
00564             image,
00565             self.terrainColorMap,
00566             tileFunction,
00567             None,
00568             0,
00569             0,
00570             WORLD_W,
00571             WORLD_H)
00572 
00573         return image, 0.8, 1.0, 1.0
00574

00576     def getPopulationDensityImageAlphaSize(self):
00577         image = self.populationDensityImage
00578         if not image:
00579             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W_2, WORLD_H_2)
00580             self.populationDensityImage = image
00581         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00582 
00583         buffer = self.getPopulationDensityMapBuffer()
00584         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00585         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00586         tengine.width = WORLD_W_2
00587         tengine.height = WORLD_H_2
00588 
00589         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00590         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_UNSIGNED
00591         tengine.colBytes = WORLD_H_2
00592         tengine.rowBytes = 1
00593 
00594         tengine.renderPixels(
00595             image,
00596             self.dataColorMap,
00597             None,
00598             None,
00599             0,
00600             0,
00601             WORLD_W_2,
00602             WORLD_H_2)
00603 
00604         return image, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0
00605 
00606 
00607     def getRateOfGrowthImageAlphaSize(self):
00608         image = self.rateOfGrowthImage
00609         if not image:
00610             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W_8, WORLD_H_8)
00611             self.rateOfGrowthImage = image
00612         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00613 
00614         buffer = self.getRateOfGrowthMapBuffer()
00615         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00616         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00617         tengine.width = WORLD_W_8
00618         tengine.height = WORLD_H_8
00619 
00620         # Signed short tile values, in column major order.
00621         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_SIGNED
00622         tengine.colBytes = WORLD_H_8 * 2
00623         tengine.rowBytes = 2
00624 
00625         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00626             return max(0, min(int(((tile * 256) / 200) + 128), 255))
00627 
00628         tengine.renderPixels(
00629             image,
00630             self.rateColorMap,
00631             tileFunction,
00632             None,
00633             0,
00634             0,
00635             WORLD_W_8,
00636             WORLD_H_8)
00637 
00638         ratio = (float(WORLD_H) / 8.0) / float(WORLD_H_8)
00639         return image, 0.5, 1.0, ratio
00640

00697             0,
00698             WORLD_W_2,
00699             WORLD_H_2)
00700 
00701         return image, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0
00702 
00703 
00704     def getPollutionDensityImageAlphaSize(self):
00705         image = self.pollutionDensityImage
00706         if not image:
00707             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W_2, WORLD_H_2)
00708             self.pollutionDensityImage = image
00709         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00710 
00711         buffer = self.getPollutionDensityMapBuffer()
00712         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00713         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00714         tengine.width = WORLD_W_2
00715         tengine.height = WORLD_H_2
00716 
00717         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00718         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_UNSIGNED
00719         tengine.colBytes = WORLD_H_2
00720         tengine.rowBytes = 1
00721 
00722         tengine.renderPixels(
00723             image,
00724             self.dataColorMap,
00725             None,
00726             None,
00727             0,
00728             0,
00729             WORLD_W_2,
00730             WORLD_H_2)
00731 
00732         return image, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0

00751         tengine.rowBytes = 1

00753         tengine.renderPixels(
00754             image,
00755             self.dataColorMap,
00756             None,
00757             None,

00765 
00766     def getPowerGridImageAlphaSize(self):
00767         image = self.powerGridImage
00768         if not image:
00769             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W, WORLD_H)
00770             self.powerGridImage = image
00771         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00772 
00773         buffer = self.getPowerGridMapBuffer()
00774         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00775         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00776         tengine.width = WORLD_W
00777         tengine.height = WORLD_H
00778 
00779         # Unsigned byte tile values, in column major order.
00780         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_BYTE_UNSIGNED
00781         tengine.colBytes = WORLD_H
00782         tengine.rowBytes = 1
00783 
00784         transparent = 0
00785         unpowered = 1
00786         powered = 2
00787         conductive = 3
00788         getTile = self.getTile
00789 
00790         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00791             t = getTile(col, row)
00792             tileMasked = t & LOMASK
00793             if tileMasked < LASTFIRE:
00794                 result = transparent
00795             elif t & ZONEBIT:
00796                 if t & PWRBIT:
00797                     result = powered
00798                 else:
00799                     result = unpowered
00800             else:
00801                 if t & CONDBIT:
00802                     result = conductive
00803                 else:
00804                     result = transparent
00805             return result
00806 
00807         tengine.renderPixels(
00808             image,
00809             self.powerGridColorMap,
00810             tileFunction,
00811             None,
00812             0,
00813             0,
00814             WORLD_W,
00815             WORLD_H)
00816 
00817         return image, 0.85, 1.0, 1.0
00818 
00819 
00820     def getFireCoverageImageAlphaSize(self):
00821         image = self.fireCoverageImage
00822         if not image:
00823             image = self.makeImage(WORLD_W_8, WORLD_H_8)
00824             self.fireCoverageImage = image
00825         tengine = self.dataTileEngine
00826 
00827         buffer = self.getFireCoverageMapBuffer()
00828         #print "Map buffer", buffer
00829         tengine.setBuffer(buffer)
00830         tengine.width = WORLD_W_8
00831         tengine.height = WORLD_H_8
00832 
00833         # Unsigned short tile values, in column major order.
00834         tengine.tileFormat = tileengine.TILE_FORMAT_SHORT_UNSIGNED
00835         tengine.colBytes = WORLD_H_8 * 2
00836         tengine.rowBytes = 2
00837 
00838         def tileFunction(col, row, tile):
00839             return max(0, min(tile, 255))
00840 
00841         tengine.renderPixels(
00842             image,
00843             self.dataColorMap,
00844             tileFunction,
00845             None,
00846             0,
00847             0,
00848             WORLD_W_8,
00849             WORLD_H_8)
00850 
00851         ratio = (float(WORLD_H) / 8.0) / float(WORLD_H_8)
00852         return image, 0.5, 1.0, ratio
00853

00890     def makeImage(self, width, height):
00891         return self.dataColorMap.create_similar(
00892             cairo.CONTENT_COLOR_ALPHA, width, height)

00907     def update(
00908         self,
00909         name,
00910         *args):
00911 
00912         #print "MicropolisEngine update", self, name, args
00913 
00914         if name == 'paused':
00915             self.running = not self.simPaused
00916             print "PAUSED", self.simPaused, "running", self.running
00917             if self.running:
00918                 self.startTimer()
00919             else:
00920                 self.stopTimer()
00921 
00922 
00923     def sendUpdate(self, name, *args):
00924         #print "SENDUPDATE", name, args
00925         interests = self.interests
00926         a = interests.get(name)
00927         if a:
00928             for view in a:
00929                 view.update(name, *args)
00930 
00931 
00932     def expressInterest(self, view, names):
00933         interests = self.interests
00934         for name in names:
00935             a = interests.get(name, None) or []
00936             if not a:
00937                 interests[name] = a
00938             if view not in a:
00939                 a.append(view)
00940 
00941 
00942     def revokeInterest(self, view, names):
00943         interests = self.interests
00944         for name in names:
00945             a = interests.get(name, None)
00946             if a and (view in a):
00947                 a.remove(view)

00950     def loadMetaCity(self, metaFilePath):
00951 
00952         doc = xml.dom.minidom.parse(metaFilePath)
00953         el = doc.firstChild
00954         if el.nodeName != 'metaCity':
00955             raise Exception("Expected top level 'metaCity' element in meta city file")
00956 
00957         saveFileDir, metaFileName = os.path.split(os.path.abspath(metaFilePath))
00958         saveFileName = GetSubElementText(el, u'saveFileName', None)
00959         title = GetSubElementText(el, u'title', '')
00960         description = GetSubElementText(el, u'description', '')
00961         readOnly = GetSubElementBool(el, u'readOnly', False)
00962 
00963         self.saveFileDir = saveFileDir
00964         self.metaFileName = metaFileName
00965         self.saveFileName = saveFileName
00966         self.title = title
00967         self.description = description
00968         self.readOnly = readOnly
00969 
00970         saveFilePath = os.path.join(saveFileDir, saveFileName)
00971 
00972         saveFilePath = saveFilePath.encode('utf8')
00973         #print "Loading city file:", saveFilePath
00974         success = self.loadCity(saveFilePath)
00975 
00976         if not success:
00977             raise Exception('Error loading city file')
00978 
00979         self.sendUpdate('load')
00980 
00981 
00982     def saveMetaCity(self, metaFileName=None):
00983 
00984         saveFileDir = self.saveFileDir
00985         metaFileName = metaFileName or self.metaFileName
00986         saveFileName = self.saveFileName
00987         readOnly = self.readOnly
00988 
00989         if not metaFileName:
00990             raise Exception('Undefined metaFileName')
00991 
00992         if readOnly or not saveFileDir:
00993             readOnly = False
00994             self.readOnly = readOnly
00995             saveFileDir = os.path.expanduser('~/cities')
00996             self.saveFileDir = saveFileDir
00997             os.makedirs(saveFileDir)
00998 
00999         baseName, ext = os.path.splitext(metaFileName)
01000 
01001         saveFileName = baseName + '.cty'
01002         self.saveFileName = saveFileName
01003 
01004         saveFilePath = os.path.join(saveFileDir, saveFileName)
01005 
01006         success = self.saveCityAs(saveFilePath)
01007 
01008         if not success:
01009             raise('Error writing to city file')
01010 
01011         xmlText = self.getMetaData(saveFileName)
01012 
01013         metaFilePath = os.path.join(saveFileDir, metaFileName)
01014 
01015         f = open(metaFilePath, 'wb')
01016         print xmlText
01017         f.write(xmlText)
01018         f.close()
01019 
01020 
01021     def getMetaData(self):
01022         doc = xml.dom.minidom.Document()
01023         el = doc.createElement(u'metaCity')
01024         doc.appendChild(el)
01025 
01026         SetSubElementText(el, u'title', self.title)
01027         SetSubElementText(el, u'description', self.description)
01028         SetSubElementBool(el, u'readOnly', self.readOnly)
01029 
01030         return doc.toxml()

01033     def loadMetaScenario(self, id):
01034         if ((id <= micropolisengine.SC_NONE) or
01035             (id >= micropolisengine.SC_COUNT)):
01036             print "loadMetaScenario: Invalid scenario id:", id
01037             return
01038 
01039         scenario = self.scenarios[id]
01040         self.title = scenario['title']
01041         self.description = scenario['description']
01042         self.loadScenario(id)
01043         self.sendUpdate('load')
01044 
01045         self.sendUpdate('message', id, -1, -1, True, True)

01059     def dumpRobots(self):
01060         robots = self.robots
01061         print "==== robots", len(robots)
01062         for robot in robots:
01063             print "robot", robot.x, robot.y, "zone", robot.zone.x, robot.zone.y, robot, robot.zone

01066     def addRobot(self, robot):
01067         #print "ADDROBOT", robot
01068 
01069         robots = self.robots
01070         if robot in robots:
01071             self.removeRobot(robot)
01072 
01073         robots.append(robot)
01074 
01075         robotDict = self.robotDict
01076         robotDict[robot.robotID] = robot
01077 
01078         robot.engine = self
01079         #print "*** SET ENGINE", self, robot
01080 
01081         #self.dumpRobots()
01082 
01083 
01084     def removeRobot(self, robot):
01085         #print "REMOVEROBOT", robot
01086 
01087         robots = self.robots
01088         if robot in robots:
01089             robots.remove(robot)
01090 
01091         robotDict = self.robotDict
01092         robotID = robot.robotID
01093         if robotID in robotDict:
01094             del robotDict[robotID]
01095 
01096         robot.engine = None
01097 
01098         #self.dumpRobots()
01099 
01100 
01101     def getRobot(self, robotID):
01102         return self.robotDict.get(robotID, None)

01104 
01105     def clearRobots(self):
01106         for robot in list(self.robots):
01107             self.removeRobot(robot)

01110     def simRobots(self):
01111         #print "SIMROBOTS"
01112         for robot in self.robots:
01113             #print "SIMROBOT LOOP", robot
01114             robot.simulate()
01115             #print "SIMULATED ROBOT", robot

01118     def simZones(self):
01119 
01120         for zone in self.zoneMap.values():
01121             zone.tick()

01124     def isRoad(self, tx, ty):
01125         tile = self.getTile(tx, ty) & LOMASK
01126         return ((tile >= micropolisengine.ROADBASE) and
01127                 (tile < micropolisengine.POWERBASE))

01131         self.lastLoopTime = time.time()

01134     def resetCity(self):
01135         #print "resetCity", self
01136         self.clearRobots()
01137         self.clearZones()
01138         self.resetRealTime()
01139         self.updateFundEffects()

01142     def clearZones(self):
01143         for zone in list(self.zoneMap.values()):
01144             self.removeZone(zone)

01147     def addZone(self, zone):
01148         zoneMap = self.zoneMap
01149         key = (zone.x, zone.y, zone.churchNumber)
01150         if key not in zoneMap:
01151             #print "ADDZONE", key, zone
01152             self.zoneMap[key] = zone
01153 
01154 
01155     def removeZone(self, zone):
01156         zoneMap = self.zoneMap
01157         key = (zone.x, zone.y, zone.churchNumber)
01158         if key in zoneMap:
01159             #print "REMOVEZONE", zone
01160             del zoneMap[key]

01167     def invokeCallback(self, micropolis, name, *args):
01168         # In this case, micropolis is the same as self, so ignore it.
01169         handler = getattr(self, 'handle_' + name, None)
01170         if handler:
01171             #print "Calling handler", handler, args
01172             handler(*args)
01173             #print "Called handler."
01174         else:
01175             print "No handler for", name

01285     def handle_simulateChurch(self, x, y, churchNumber):
01286         #print "handle_simulateChurch", x, y, churchNumber, self.simPaused
01287 
01288         if self.simPaused:
01289             return
01290 
01291         key = (x, y, churchNumber)
01292         zone = self.zoneMap.get(key, None)
01293         if not zone:
01294             #print "key", key, "zone", zone, "x", x, "y", y
01295             zone = micropoliszone.ZoneClasses[churchNumber](
01296                 engine=self,
01297                 x=x,
01298                 y=y,
01299                 churchNumber=churchNumber)
01300             self.addZone(zone)
01301 
01302         zone.simulate()
01303
